objectives: Students will discuss work and career using Slang/Street register language
Students will engage with Horror themed scenarios related to work and career
Students will demonstrate appropriate use of slang level vocabulary and expressions
Students will create dialogues combining work and career content with Horror narrative elements

warm_up.description: Students explore work and career through a Horror lens using Slang/Street language
warm_up.scenario: Imagine a frightening or supernatural situation involving work and career

main_activities.description: Students learn and practice slang register vocabulary related to work and career in a horror context
Students engage in horror themed role-play about work and career using slang register
Students create original horror themed content about work and career in slang register

discussion_questions: How would you describe work and career in a Horror scenario?
What terror or darkness might be involved in work and career?
Can you create a Horror story about work and career?
How does work and career change when viewed through a Horror perspective?
What slang register expressions would you use to discuss this horror scenario?

role_play_scenarios.scenario: Horror situation involving work and career
roles: Character A: Using slang register in horror context
Character B: Responding in slang register within horror theme

teacher_transformation_guide.register_guidance: Use Slang/Street throughout: Casual street language, colloquialisms, youth speak
teacher_transformation_guide.genre_guidance: Frame all content with Horror theme: Fear, suspense, supernatural elements

assessment.register_focus: Students demonstrate mastery of Slang/Street register
assessment.genre_focus: Students engage with Horror themed content
criteria: Appropriate use of slang register language
Comprehension of topic within new context

methodology: Augmented CLT with Register & Genre Transformation
